Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the length of time the man served in prison for the bank robbery, stating that he only served two years when in reality he served the full 13-year sentence.
Understate: The claim understates the severity of the man's actions, as it fails to mention that he shot and killed two people after the traffic accident.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the statement about the man's sentence and release.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the reason the man was "back on the street" was solely due to his sentence for bank robbery, without considering other factors that may have influenced his release.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for why the man was released, such as parole or good behavior, that are not mentioned in the claim.
